text: Gerald Michael "Gerry" Anderson (28 October 1944 - 21 August 2014) was a Northern Irish radio and television broadcaster. He worked for BBC Northern Ireland. He was known for his unique style and somewhat unusual sense of humor. Anderson often called himself on his show, as "Turkey Neck", "Puppet Chin" or "Golf Mike Alpha". Anderson died in Belfast, Northern Ireland from a long illness, aged 69. ==References== ==Other websites== *Radio Foyle biography Category:1944 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in Northern Ireland Category:Northern Ireland people Category:British radio personalities Category:British television presenters
